newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli forces abduct Lebanese shepherd.
newsitem.headline: Israeli forces abduct Lebanese shepherd.

text.p: Israeli soldiers and allied militiamen snatched a Lebanese shepherd from an area just outside Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone on Wednesday, security sources said.

They said the Israeli force, backed by South Lebanon Army (SLA) militiamen, held Mohammad Nayef near the village of Dallafeh just north of the eastern sector of the south Lebanon zone and forced him to enter the border strip with his flock.
Some 1,000 Israeli troops and 3,000 allied SLA militiamen patrol the 15-km (nine-mile)-deep zone in south Lebanon set up to prevent cross-border raids on northern Israel.
